page.title: 01Farmland North of Shrewsbury
page.content: This is a predominantly agricultural area consisting of land cultivated for crops and intensively managed grassland, The field boundaries are marked with neat hedges. Trees play a pleasing role in the landscape interspersed amongst the fields and also several small wooded areas. A landscape pleasing to the eye rural and undulating including the vallley created by the River Roden. Hills provide good vantage points. A very low populated aea, the majority of the residences are farms or small holdings.There are small hmlets at Barkersgreen, Aston and Lee Brockhurst, the latter having a church and village hall. The people mainly work on the land but other residents commute to town such as Wen, Shrewsbury and Market Drayton.
